abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Third Social Fund for
            Egypt were as follows: the outcome was satisfactory, risk to
            development outcome moderate, and the Bank and Borrower
            performance were both moderately satisfactory. Lessons
            learned from the project: there is a need to set out a
            hierarchy between project objectives; quality at entry can
            be compromised when projects are prepared on a fast track
            basis; Institutional issues such as monitoring and
            evaluation and targeting need to be dealt with up front
            during project preparation; and field presence can enhance
            supervision effectiveness.
